column1: An electrocardiogram (ECG) and x-rays (fluoroscopy) may also be used to help with positioning.
Some people have chest pain, which may require pain medicine.

Abnormal findings may indicate the cause of pericardial fluid accumulation, such as: - Cancer - Cardiac perforation - Cardiac trauma - Congestive heart failure - Pericarditis - Renal failure - Infection - Rupture of a ventricular aneurysm
